text: mayday is French !
reply_to: 1047 call: DGAC source says pilots called «urgence, urgence» (“emergency, emergency”), as opposed to a mayday call or 7700 squawk. #4U9525

text: Lots of radio protocol is French ... Mayday is M'aidez . Urgence , pan-pan , " see-lonce " etc .
reply_to: They made that call in French ?

text: Roger . Just seems odd given most comms are in English . Doesn't make it wrong , of course .
reply_to: Lots of radio protocol is French ... Mayday is M'aidez . Urgence , pan-pan , " see-lonce " etc .

text: is that unusual ?
reply_to: 1047 call: DGAC source says pilots called «urgence, urgence» (“emergency, emergency”), as opposed to a mayday call or 7700 squawk. #4U9525
